description: Does nothing. The script engine will ignore the two bytes this opcode produces and immediately continue with the following code. It's commonly used to allocate extra bytes in the script for storage or act as padding between segments.
Pause the execution of the current script for (at least) N milliseconds. A value of 0 allows the game to continue rendering but continues the script as soon as possible.
Go to a label and continue code execution from there.
Shakes the camera. The parameter determines both the time and intensity.
Sets the value of the VAR.
Sets the float value of the VAR.
Sets the integer value of the LVAR.
Sets the float value of the LVAR.
Adds the value to the value of the int VAR.
Adds the value to the value of the float VAR.
Adds the value to the value of the integer LVAR.
Adds the value to the value of the float LVAR.
Subtracts the value from the value of the integer VAR.
Subtracts the value from the value of the float VAR.
Subtracts the value from the value of the int LVAR.
Subtracts the value from the value of the float LVAR.
Multiplies the int VAR by the value.
Multiplies the float VAR by the value.
Multiplies the int LVAR by the value.
Multiplies the float LVAR by the value.
Divides the int VAR by the value.
Divides the float VAR by the value.
Divides the int LVAR by the value.
Divides the float LVAR by the value.
Returns true if the int VAR value is greater than the value.
Returns true if the int LVAR value is greater than the value.
Returns true if the value is greater than the int VAR value.
Returns true if the value is greater than the int LVAR value.
Returns true if the int VAR value is greater than the other int VAR value.
Returns true if the int LVAR value is greater than the other int LVAR value.
Returns true if the int VAR value is greater than the int LVAR value.
Returns true if the int LVAR value is greater than the int VAR value.
Returns true if the float VAR value is greater than the float value.
Returns true if the float LVAR value is greater than the float value.
Returns true if the float value is greater than the float VAR value.
Returns true if the float value is greater than the float LVAR value.
Returns true if the float VAR value is greater than the other float VAR value.
Returns true if the float LVAR value is greater than the other float LVAR value.
Returns true if the float VAR value is greater than the float LVAR value.
Returns true if the float LVAR value is greater than the float VAR value.
Returns true if the int VAR value is greater or equal to the value.
Returns true if the int LVAR value is greater or equal to the value.
Returns true if the value is greater or equal to the int VAR value.
Returns true if the value is greater or equal to the int LVAR value.
Returns true if the int VAR value is greater or equal to the other int VAR value.
Returns true if the int LVAR value is greater or equal to the other int LVAR value.
Returns true if the int VAR value is greater or equal to the int LVAR value.
Returns true if the int LVAR value is greater or equal to the int VAR value.
Returns true if the float VAR value is greater or equal to the value.
Returns true if the float LVAR value is greater or equal to the value.
Returns true if the value is greater or equal to the float VAR value.
Returns true if the value is greater or equal to the float LVAR value.
Returns true if the float VAR value is greater or equal to the other float VAR value.
Returns true if the float LVAR value is greater or equal to the other float LVAR value.
Returns true if the float VAR value is greater or equal to the LVAR value.
Returns true if the float LVAR value is greater or equal to the float VAR value.
Returns true if the int VAR value is equal to the value.
Returns true if the int LVAR value is equal to the value.
Returns true if the int VAR value is equal to the other int VAR value.
Returns true if the int LVAR value is equal to the other int LVAR value.
Returns true if the int VAR value is equal to the int LVAR value.
Returns true if the float VAR value is equal to the value.
Returns true if the float LVAR value is equal to the value.
Returns true if the float VAR value is equal to the other float VAR value.
Returns true if the float LVAR value is equal to the other float LVAR value.
Returns true if the float VAR value is equal to the float LVAR value.
Go to the label if the condition result is false.
Ends the current script, preventing further execution.

Start a new script at the specified label. This command is capable of handling up to 31 extra parameters, each parameter specifies the initial values of the variables in the new script. Use 004E to terminate the script.
Go to the label as a subroutine. Use 0051 to return from the subroutine.
Return from the current subroutine.

Creates a player at the specified position. First parameter is the index of the player. There can only be 2 players by default. Player 1 wears the default CJ skin with the default clothes. Player 2 wears the same model as currently set for Player 1. Creating Player 2 will display a new HUD. To change the clothes of a player, use 087B. To change the model of a player, use 097C. To delete extra players, use 06DF.
Returns the current coordinates of the player.
Puts the player at the specified coordinates.
Returns true if the player is within a specified area.
Returns true if the player is within the specified area cube.
Adds the int VAR value to the other int VAR.
Adds the float VAR value to the other float VAR.
Adds the int LVAR value to the other int LVAR.
Adds the float LVAR value to the other float LVAR.
Adds the int VAR value to the int LVAR.
Adds the float VAR value to the float LVAR.
Adds the float LVAR value to the float VAR.
Adds the float LVAR value to the float VAR.
Subtracts the int VAR value from the int VAR.
Subtracts the float VAR value from the float VAR.
Subtracts the int LVAR value from the int LVAR.
Subtracts the float LVAR value from the float LVAR.
Subtracts the int VAR value from the int LVAR.
Subtracts the float VAR value from the float LVAR.
Subtracts the float LVAR value from the float VAR.
Subtracts the float LVAR value from the float VAR.
Multiplies the int VAR value by the int VAR.
Multiplies the float VAR value by the float VAR.
Multiplies the int LVAR value by the int LVAR.
Multiplies the int LVAR value by the int LVAR.
Multiplies the int VAR value by the int LVAR.
Multiplies the float VAR value by the float LVAR.
Multiplies the int LVAR value by the int VAR.
Multiplies the float LVAR value by the float VAR.
Divides the int VAR value by the int VAR.
Divides the float VAR value by the float VAR.
Divides the int LVAR by the int LVAR.
Divides the float LVAR by the float LVAR.
Divides the int VAR by the int LVAR.
Divides the float VAR by the float LVAR.
Divides the int LVAR by the int VAR.
Divides the float LVAR by the float VAR.

Multiplies the delta time since the last frame by the specified value and adds the result to the specified variable. The frame delta time is the time passed since the last frame. Useful to prevent lag when drawing screen objects on slow (often pausing) computers. Using this you could advance the drawing along by the time that has passed (the time that a PC could've stopped for) in milliseconds since the last frame which would help to eliminate the effects of lag.

Multiplies the delta time since the last frame by the specified value and adds the result to the specified variable. The frame delta time is the time passed since the last frame. Useful to prevent lag when drawing screen objects on slow (often pausing) computers. Using this you could advance the drawing along by the time that has passed (the time that a PC could've stopped for) in milliseconds since the last frame which would help to eliminate the effects of lag.
Multiplies the delta time since the last frame by the float value of the specified global variable and adds the result to the specified global variable. See 0078.
Multiplies the delta time since the last frame by the float value of the specified local variable and adds the result to the specified local variable. See 0078.
Multiplies the delta time since the last frame by the float value of the specified global variable and adds the result to the specified local variable. See 0078.
Multiplies the delta time since the last frame by the float value of the specified local variable and adds the result to the specified global variable. See 0078.
Multiplies the delta time since the last frame by the specified float value and subtracts the result from the specified global variable. See 0078.
Multiplies the delta time since the last frame by the specified value and subtracts the result from the specified local variable. See 0078.
Multiplies the delta time since the last frame by the value of the specified global variable and subtracts the result from the specified global variable. See 0078.
Multiplies the delta time since the last frame by the value of the specified local variable and adds the result to the specified local variable. See 0078.
Multiplies the delta time since the last frame by the value of the specified global variable and subtracts the result from the specified local variable. See 0078.

Multiplies the frame delta time (the time in milleseconds that has passed since the last frame) by float stored in the specified local variable. Then subtracts the result from the specified global variable. This is made to be used with the texture drawing opcodes (mainly by minigames) to soften the annoyances of lag on some computers.
Sets the int VAR to the VAR value.
Sets the int LVAR to the LVAR value.
Sets the float VAR to the VAR value.
Sets the float LVAR to the LVAR value.
Sets the float VAR to the LVAR value.
Sets the float LVAR to the VAR value.
Sets the int VAR to the LVAR value.
Sets the int LVAR to the VAR value.
Converts the float in the second global variable to an integer (via flooring) and stores the integer into the first global variable.
Converts the integer value of the second global variable to a float and stores the result in the first global variable.
Converts the float value of the global variable to an integer (via flooring) and stores the result into a local variable.
Converts the integer value of the global variable to a float and then stores the result in the local variable.
Converts the float value of the local variable to an integer (via flooring) and stores the result to the global variable.
Converts the integer value of the local variable to a float and stores the result in the global variable.
Converts a float value to an integer (via truncating). Examples 1.2 > 1 1.9 > 1 0.2 > 0 -1.3 > -1
Converts the integer value of the second local variable to a float and stores the result to the first local variable.
Makes a negative integer positive.
Makes a negative number posotive.
Makes a negative float a posotive.
Makes a negative float posotive.
Gets a random float between 0.0 and 1.0 and stores the result into a variable.

SA: Gets a random integer between 0 and 32767 (max signed 16-bit) and stores the result to a variable. VC & III: Gets a random integer between 0 and 65535 (max unsigned 16-bit) and stores the result to a variable.
Creates an character at the specified coordinates, with the specified model and pedtype. The characters handle is written to the specified variable.
Removes the character from the game and mission cleanup list, freeing game memory. Note: The character not existing will not cause the game to crash.
Returns the characters 3D coordinates.
Puts the actor at the specified X, Y and Z coordinates.
Checks if the actor is in the specified rectangular zone.
Returns true if the character is in the specified area cube.
Creates a car at the specified coordinates, with the specified model. The cars handle is stored into the specified variable.
Removes the vehicle from the game.
Makes a car drive to the specified coordinates.
Clears any current tasks the vehicle has and makes it drive around aimlessly.
Sets the cars mission to idle (MISSION_NONE), stopping any driving activity.
Stores the X, Y and Z position of the specified car into separate variables.
Places the car with the specified handle at the specified X, Y and Z coordinates.
Enables the specified car to drive at any speed under the specified float value.
Sets the vehicles driving style. This controls how it obeys the rules of the road.

Adds a mission for the car. A car can have multiple missions at once. Missions 0, None / Idle, MISSION_NONE 1, Wander (as set by 00A8), MISSION_CRUISE 2, Ram player from a far position, MISSION_RAMPLAYER_FARAWAY 3, Ram player from a close position (set when mission 2 is given and the car gets close to the player) MISSION_RAMPLAYER_CLOSE 4, Obstruct player from a far position, MISSION_BLOCKPLAYER_FARAWAY 5, Obstruct player from a close position (set when mission 4 is given and the car gets close to the player) MISSION_BLOCKPLAYER_CLOSE 6, Obstruct player (idle, obstructing player) MISSION_BLOCKPLAYER_HANDBRAKESTOP 7, Wait to be deleted MISSION_WAITFORDELETION 8, Follow coords from a far position (as set by 00A7) MISSION_GOTOCOORDS 9, Follow coords from a close position (set when mission 8 is given and the car nears the coords) MISSION_GOTOCOORDS_STRAIGHT 10, Idle emergancy vehicle, MISSION_EMERGENCYVEHICLE_STOP 11, Idle, MISSION_STOP_FOREVER 12, Follow coords accurately from a far position (as set by 02C2) MISSION_GOTOCOORDS_ACCURATE 13, Follow coords accurately from a close position, MISSION_GOTO_COORDS_STRAIGHT_ACCURATE 14, Rockstar have a sense of humor?, MISSION_GOTOCOORDS_ASTHECROWSWIMS 15, Ram a car from far away, MISSION_RAMCAR_FARAWAY 16, Ram a car from close up, MISSION_RAMCAR_CLOSE 17, Block a car from far away, MISSION_BLOCKCAR_FARAWAY 18, Block a car from close up, MISSION_BLOCKCAR_CLOSE 19, Blocking a car, MISSION_BLOCKCAR_HANDBRAKESTOP 20, Heli fly to coords, MISSION_HELI_FLYTOCOORS 21, Attack the player, MISSION_ATTACKPLAYER 22, Plane fly to coords, MISSION_PLANE_FLYTOCOORS 23, Heli land, MISSION_HELI_LAND 24, Slowly drive to player 1, MISSION_SLOWLY_DRIVE_TOWARDS_PLAYER_1 25, Slowly drive to player 2, MISSION_SLOWLY_DRIVE_TOWARDS_PLAYER_2 26, Block player from both directions, MISSION_BLOCKPLAYER_FORWARDANDBACK 29, Follow car (keep to left, as set by 05F1) 30, Follow car (keep to right, as set by 05F2) 31, Follow car (keep behind, as set by 05F3) 32, Follow car (keep in front, as set by 05F4)
Returns true if the vehicle with the specified handle is in the specified rectangular zone.
Returns true if the specified vehicle is within the specified cubic zone.
Displays styled text of the specified GXT entry.
Displays a low priority text string near the bottom of the screen for the specified time. The last parameter is unused.
Displays a high priority text string for the specified time near the bottom of the screen. The last parameter is unused.
Clears all priority text and some styles of big texts.
Returns the amount of hours and minutes passed since midnight.
Sets the current in-game time to the time specified in the two parameters.
Returns the amount of minutes left until the clock matches the time specified.
Returns true if any part of the radius of the specified point is visible on screen. Useful for testing when the player is or is not looking near something.

Begins a conditional statement with the specified number of conditions. In Sanny Builder, you can replace the parameter with "and" or "or" when using more than one condition. There is no need to preposition a condition with if when you only have one condition. 004D will take the current thread result and use it to jump if it is set to false.
Launches a submission script.

Returns the current vehicle of the character and adds it to the mission cleanup list. It removes the last found vehicle from the mission cleanup list, if applicable. However, if the vehicle of the character is not found, the last found vehicle will be returned. This opcode also works in normal scripts, however a lot of code is based on missions, so it is better to use 03C0 or 0811 depending on the situation.
sannyFormat: %2d% = actor %1d% car ; add to mission cleanup

description: Returns true if the character is in the specified vehicle.
Returns true if the specified character is driving a vehicle with the specified model.
Returns true if the character has a vehicle, even if they are not actually sat inside it (opening and closing the door). Use 0449 to check if the character is sitting in a car.
Returns true if the player is pressing the specified key.
Returns true if the player stopped near the specified 2D point.
sannyFormat: player %1d% stopped %6b:in-sphere/%near_point %2d% %3d% radius %4d% %5d%  ;; never used in VC
player %1d% stopped %6b:in-sphere/%near_point_in_car %2d% %3d% radius %4d% %5d%  ;; never used in VC

description: Returns true if the actor is near the specified point, irrelevant of height.
Returns true if the actor is in the specified area on foot, irrelevant of height.
Returns true if the actor is in a car in the specified area, irrelevant of height.

sannyFormat: actor %1d% sphere %6b:in-sphere/%near_point %2d% %3d% radius %4d% %5d%  ;; never used in VC

description: Returns true if the actor is near the specified point with the specified radius and is in a car which is not moving. The sphere flag sets whether there should be a red circle indicating the point and radius the actor must be in.
sannyFormat: actor %1d% stopped %6b:in-sphere/%near_point_in_car %2d% %3d% radius %4d% %5d%  ;; never used in VC

description: Returns true if the actor is in a car, which is in radius of another actor.
sannyFormat: actor %1d% near_actor_in_car %2d% radius %3d% %4d% %5h%  ;; never used in VC or GTA 3

description: Sets up a point on the map where the characters presence can be detected. If the 'sphere' bool is set to true, a cyllinder marker will indicate the position of the target point. This 'LOCATE' command returns true under the highlighted conditions: Character is within the radius of the point Character is in a vehicle Character is on foot Character is moving Character is stopped

Sets up a point on the map where the characters presence can be detected. If the 'sphere' bool is set to true, a cyllinder marker will indicate the position of the target point. This 'LOCATE' command returns true under the highlighted conditions: Character is within the radius of the point Character is in a vehicle Character is on foot Character is moving Character is stopped

Sets up a point on the map where the characters presence can be detected. If the 'sphere' bool is set to true, a cyllinder marker will indicate the position of the target point. This 'LOCATE' command returns true under the highlighted conditions: Character is within the radius of the point Character is in a vehicle Character is on foot Character is moving Character is stopped

Sets up a point on the map where the characters presence can be detected. If the 'sphere' bool is set to true, a cyllinder marker will indicate the position of the target point. This 'LOCATE' command returns true under the highlighted conditions: Character is within the radius of the point Character is in a vehicle Character is on foot Character is moving Character is stopped

Sets up a point on the map where the characters presence can be detected. If the 'sphere' bool is set to true, a cyllinder marker will indicate the position of the target point. This 'LOCATE' command returns true under the highlighted conditions: Character is within the radius of the point Character is in a vehicle Character is on foot Character is moving Character is stopped

Sets up a point on the map where the characters presence can be detected. If the 'sphere' bool is set to true, a cyllinder marker will indicate the position of the target point. This 'LOCATE' command returns true under the highlighted conditions: Character is within the radius of the point Character is in a vehicle Character is on foot Character is moving Character is stopped
sannyFormat: actor %1d% stopped_near_point_in_car %2d% %3d% %4d% radius %5d% %6d% %7d% sphere %8d%  ;; never used in VC

description: Returns true if one actor is in radius of the other actor, with the optional addition of a sphere surrounding the actor. Sets up a radius from a character where another characters presence can be detected. If the 'sphere' bool is set to true, a cyllinder marker will indicate the position of the target point. This 'LOCATE' command returns true under the highlighted conditions: Character is within the radius of the character Character is in a vehicle Character is on foot Character is moving Character is stopped

Sets up a radius from a character where another characters presence can be detected. If the 'sphere' bool is set to true, a cyllinder marker will indicate the position of the target point. This 'LOCATE' command returns true under the highlighted conditions: Character is within the radius of the character Character is in a vehicle Character is on foot Character is moving Character is stopped
sannyFormat: actor %1d% near_actor_on_foot %2d% radius %3d% %4d% %5d% sphere %6h%  ;; never used in VC or gta 3

description: Sets up a radius from a character where another characters presence can be detected. If the 'sphere' bool is set to true, a cyllinder marker will indicate the position of the target point. This 'LOCATE' command returns true under the highlighted conditions: Character is within the radius of the character Character is in a vehicle Character is on foot Character is moving Character is stopped
sannyFormat: actor %1d% near_actor_in_car %2d% radius %3d% %4d% %5d% %6h%  ;; never used in VC or gta 3

description: Creates an object with the specified model at the specified coordinates and stores it into a variable.
Destroys the specified object, freeing game memory.
Returns true if the players money is over the specified value.
Returns the players score (money).
Gives control of the RC vehicle to the player.
Sets the players wanted level.
Sets the players wanted level if the specified level is higher than the current one.
Returns true if the players wanted level is other the specified value.
Clears the players wanted level.
Returns true if the player is killed (wasted) or arrested (busted).
Adds the specified amount of ammo to the characters weapon, if the character has the weapon.
Returns true if the player is dead (wasted).
Returns true if the character is dead (wasted).
Returns true if the car has been destroyed (wrecked) or doesn't exist (invalid handle).
Gives the character nothing to do.
Returns true if the player is in the specified zone.
Returns true if the player is honking the horn in a car.
Returns true if the character has seen the player.
Returns true if the character has completed their task.
Creates a character in the driver seat of the car. This command is similar to 009A, except it creates the character in a car.
Sets the players coordinates, removing them from any vehicle they're in.
Returns true if car with the specified handle has the specified model.

Initializes a parked car generator, meaning that a vehicle with the specified parameters will spawn xx number of times. Use 014C to change the amount of times the vehicle will spawn. force_spawn 0 - sometimes spawns, sometimes doesn't 1 - always spawns (even when player is looking) alarm The chance of the cars alarm going off. door_lock The chance of the car door being locked. The colour value for this opcode uses a carcol.dat ID. You can get a list of them by following the links below. San Andreas Car Colours Vice City and GTA III Car Colours
sannyFormat: %13d% = init_car_generator %5o% %6d% %7d% force_spawn %8d% alarm %9d% door_lock %10d% min_delay %11d% max_delay %12d% at %1d% %2d% %3d% angle %4d%

description: Specifies the amount of times the specified car generator spawns a car. 0 - Car will never spawn. 1-100 - Car will spawn xx number of times. 101 - Car will always spawn.

Creates an onscreen timer. The game will use the global variable passed to read and write the time. This will not work with local variables. Only one timer can exist at once. The direction flag sets whether the timer should count down or up. 0 - Up 1 - Down If counting down, the timer will clear once it reaches 0.

sannyFormat: set_status_text %1d% type %2d%  ;; never used in VC or GTA 3

description: Returns true if the character is in the specified zone.
Attaches the camera to the specified vehicle. switchstyle 1 - smooth 2 - cut
Attaches the camera to the specified character. switchstyle 1 - smooth 2 - cut
Restores the camera to it's usual position.
Sets the game to run at the specified speed. 1.0 = default 0.0 = slowest possible. This also reduces the frequency in which the scripts are executed. 0.0 does not freeze the game.
Sets the cameras X, Y and Z position and rotation to the specified values.
Points the camera at the specified X, Y and Z coordinates and applies the position set by 0159. switchstyle 1 - smooth 2 - jump cut
Creates a floating marker above the specified vehicle. The colour parameter is unused in San Andreas.
Disables the marker with the specified handle.
Changes the colour of the blip. 0 - Red 1 - Green 2 - Light Blue 3 - White 4 - Yellow Similar Opcodes 08FB
Sets whether the blip should appear dimmed.
Adds a coloured blip at the specified location. An updated version of this command is 018A.
Sets size of the marker with the specified handle. under 3 = smaller the default size 3 = default size over 3 = bigger

Sets the RGB colour of the fade command. In GTA III and Vice City, using the integer value 2 for every parameter will result in the screen fading to a texture. In San Andreas, this combination of parameters still has an effect, however the feature is not fully implemented.
Fades for the specified time. fade 1 = fade in fade 0 = fade out
Returns true if the screen is in the middle of a fade in or out. False if the screen is fully faded in or out.
Adds a hospital restart, which is where the player will spawn after death (wasted) if the point is closer than any other hospital restart.
Adds a police restart, which is where the player will spawn after being arrested (busted) if the point is closer than any other police restart.
Overrides the next wasted or busted restart with the specified position.
Draws a shadow in the current frame.
sannyFormat: draw_shadow %1d% at %2d% %3d% %4d% angle %5d% size %6d% intensity %7d% colour %8d% %9d% %10d%

description: Returns the characters Z Angle.
Sets the characters Z Angle.
Gets the cars angle.
Sets the cars Z Angle to the specified amount.
Stores the specified objects Z Angle.
Sets the objects Z Angle to the specified amount.
Sets the variable number to be used when missions are in progress. Internally, the game will check the specified global variable whenever it needs to know if a mission is running.
Sets the mission flag var for a specific contact.
Returns true if the characters health is above the specified value.
Returns true if the specified cars health is above the specified value.
Creates a marker above the specified vehicle.
Creates a marker above the specified character.
Creates a marker above the specified object.
Creates a yellow radar checkpoint marker at the specified X, Y and Z coordinates.
Changes the blips display mode. radar_mode 0 = hide radar_mode 1 = hide radar_mode 2 = blip only radar_mode 3 = show radar_mode 4 = hide radar_mode 5 = hide
Plays a sound with the specified ID at the specified X, Y and Z coordinates.
Creates a continuous sound at the specified coordinates and stores the handle to a variable.
Stops the sound with the specified ID.
Returns true if the specified car has been upside down for more than 2 seconds.
Activates upsidedown car check for the car.
Deactivates upsidedown car check for the car.

sannyFormat: player %1d% stopped %6b:in-sphere/%in_rectangle_on_foot %2d% %3d% %4d% %5d%  ;; never used in VC
player %1d% stopped %6b:in-sphere/%in_rectangle_in_car %2d% %3d% %4d% %5d%  ;; never used in VC
player %1d% stopped %8b:in-sphere/%in_cube %2d% %3d% %4d% %5d% %6d% %7d%  ;; never used in VC
player %1d% stopped %8b:in-sphere/%in_cube_on_foot %2d% %3d% %4d% %5d% %6d% %7d%  ;; never used in VC
player %1d% stopped %8b:in-sphere/%in_cube_in_car %2d% %3d% %4d% %5d% %6d% %7d%  ;; never used in VC

description: Returns true if the character is within the specified rectangular zone on foot.
sannyFormat: actor %1d% sphere %6b:in-sphere/%in_rectangle_on_foot %2d% %3d% %4d% %5d%  ;; never used in VC

description: Returns true if the character is within the specified rectangular zone in a vehicle.

sannyFormat: actor %1d% stopped %6b:in-sphere/%in_rectangle %2d% %3d% %4d% %5d%  ;; never used in VC

description: Returns true if the character is standing still within the 2D rectangle.
sannyFormat: actor %1d% stopped %6b:in-sphere/%in_rectangle_on_foot %2d% %3d% %4d% %5d%  ; never used in VC

description: Returns true if the specified actor is in a motionless vehicle within the 2D rectangle.
sannyFormat: actor %1d% stopped %6b:in-sphere/%in_rectangle_in_car %2d% %3d% %4d% %5d%  ;; never used in VC
actor %1d% stopped %8b:in-sphere/%in_cube %2d% %3d% %4d% %5d% %6d% %7d%  ;; never used in VC

description: Returns true if the specified actor is in the specified area cube.
sannyFormat: actor %1d% stopped %8b:in-sphere/%in_cube_on_foot %2d% %3d% %4d% %5d% %6d% %7d%  ;; never used in VC

description: Returns true if the specified actor is in a motionless vehicle within the 3D cube.
sannyFormat: actor %1d% stopped %8b:in-sphere/%in_cube_in_car %2d% %3d% %4d% %5d% %6d% %7d%  ;; never used in VC
car %1d% stopped %6b:in-sphere/%in_rectangle %2d% %3d% %4d% %5d%  ;; never used in VC
car %1d% stopped %8b:in-sphere/%in_cube %2d% %3d% %4d% %5d% %6d% %7d%  ;; never used in VC

description: Returns true if the car is stopped in the radius of the specified point.

Gives the player the specified weapon with the specified ammunition. The weapon model must be loaded first, else a crash will occur. This opcode is unsupported in San Andreas. Use 01B0 and the players actor handle instead.
sannyFormat: give_player %1d% weapon %2c% ammo %3d%  ;; Load the weapon model before using this

description: Gives a weapon to an actor with the specified amount of ammunition/bullets. The weapons model must be loaded before trying to give the weapon. The ammo is usually limited to 99999 using this opcode.
sannyFormat: give_actor %1d% weapon %2c% ammo %3d%  ;; Load the weapon model before using this

description: Sets whether player control is enabled. When disabled, only camera movement and player movement is disabled. The player can still select items in a panel or menu and pressed keys can still be read.
Forces the game weather to the specified value.
Forces the upcoming weather to the specified type.
Allows the game to continue it's usual weather pattern after using 01B5.
Sets the specfied actors currently held weapon.
Gets the objects XYZ position.
Puts the specified object at the specified coordinates.
Returns the time passed in milleseconds since the game started.
Stores the players current wanted level.
Returns true if the car is not in motion.
Marks the character as no longer needed by the script, allowing it to be deleted by the game and removes it from the mission cleanup list, if applicable.

Marks the vehicle as no longer needed by the script engine, allowing it to be deleted by the game. Also removes the vehicle from the "interesting vehicles" list, if it exists on the list and releases any path it is on. Removes the vehicle from the mission cleanup list, if applicable.
Marks the object as no longer needed by the script, allowing it to be deleted by the game. Also removes it from the mission cleanup list, if applicable.
Removes the character from the mission cleanup list, preventing it from being deleted when the mission ends.
Stops an object from being destroyed when mission cleanup is run.
Creates an actor in the passenger seat of a car. passenger_seat -1 - next free seat 0 - passenger seat (or back seat of bike) 1 - left rear seat 2 - right rear seat
Displays a big print with the specified number.
Displays a print with the specified number.
Displays a print with the specified number.
Allows cars to drive in the specified area.
Prevents cars from driving on roads in the specified area.
Stores the number of passengers sitting in a car.
Stores the maximum amount of passengers that could sit in a vehicle.
Sets the amount of traffic that will spawn in the game. 0.0 = no traffic. 1.0 = default. 2.0 = lot's of traffic.
Sets whether the car is heavy.
Sets the maximum wanted level the player can receive.
Returns true if the vehicle is in the air.
Returns true if the car is upside down.
Gets the character handle for the specified player.
Stops the player from spawning at the override coordinates.
Sets whether cops should ignore the player regardless of wanted level.

Initializes a rampage. Parameters 1 = GXT to show up at the start of rampage. 2 = Weapon ID to use for rampage. 3 = Rampage time limit. 4 = Amount of kills to pass rampage. 5-8 = Models which count towards a kill in the rampage. 9 = Should the GXT Entry 'KILLPA' show up when completed? The models can be set to -1 for any ped and -2 for any vehicle.
Gets the status of the current rampage.
Gets the square root of a number.

sannyFormat: player %1d% near_car_on_foot %2d% radius %3d% %4d% %5d%  ;; never used in VC
player %1d% near_car_on_foot %2d% radius %3d% %4d% %5d% unknown %6h%  ;; never used in VC
player %1d% near_car_in_car %2d% radius %3d% %4d% %5d% unknown %6h%  ;; never used in VC
actor %1d% near_car_in_car %2d% radius %3d% %4d% unknown %5d%  ;; never used in VC
actor %1d% near_car_on_foot %2d% radius %3d% %4d% %5d% unknown %6h%  ;; never used in VC
actor %1d% near_car_in_car %2d% radius %3d% %4d% %5d% unknown %6h%  ;; never used in VC

description: Generates a random float between the ranges specified.
Generates a random integer between the ranges specified. If the two integers are 0 and 10, the highest possible number is 9. The lowest possible number is 0.

Sets the locked status of the cars doors. 1 = unlocked 2 = locked 3 = unlocked for NPC's 4 = locked 5 = locked (cop car doors) 6 = unlocked, doors stay on car 7 = locked, doors can fall off 8 = locked
Makes the vehicle explode.
Creates an explosion. See this topic for a list of ID's that are used for the "with_radius" parameter.
Returns true if the specified car is upside down.

Creates a pickup with the given model and type at the given X, Y and Z coordinates. Rockstar's pickup enum from the MTA Source: 0 - PICKUP_NONE 1 - PICKUP_IN_SHOP 2 - PICKUP_ON_STREET 3 - PICKUP_ONCE 4 - PICKUP_ONCE_TIMEOUT 5 - PICKUP_ONCE_TIMEOUT_SLOW 6 - PICKUP_COLLECTABLE1 7 - PICKUP_IN_SHOP_OUT_OF_STOCK 8 - PICKUP_MONEY 9 - PICKUP_MINE_INACTIVE 10 - PICKUP_MINE_ARMED 11 - PICKUP_NAUTICAL_MINE_INACTIVE 12 - PICKUP_NAUTICAL_MINE_ARMED 13 - PICKUP_FLOATINGPACKAGE 14 - PICKUP_FLOATINGPACKAGE_FLOATING 15 - PICKUP_ON_STREET_SLOW 16 - PICKUP_ASSET_REVENUE 17 - PICKUP_PROPERTY_LOCKED 18 - PICKUP_PROPERTY_FORSALE 19 - PICKUP_MONEY_DOESNTDISAPPEAR 20 - PICKUP_SNAPSHOT 21 - PICKUP_2P 22 - PICKUP_ONCE_FOR_MISSION
Returns true if specified pickup has been collected.
Detroys the specified pickup, freeing game memory.
Turns the yellow Taxi light on for the specified vehicle.
Queues a big print.
Sets the specified garage to only accept a specific car.
Applies brakes to the players car.
Sets the players remaining health to the specified amount.
Sets the health of the character to the specified value.
Sets the health of the vehicle to the specified value.
Returns the characters health.
Stores the vehicles health in a variable.
Sets the cars primary and secondary colours to the specified values.
Enables pedestrians walk into the specified area.
Forbids pedestrians to walk into the specified area.
Sets the models used by members of the specified gang.
Sets the car used by members of the specified gang.
Sets the weapons that the specified gang can use.
Loads a special character.
Returns true if the specified special actor is available for creation.
Returns true if the player is controlling an RC vehicle.
Sets the position for a cutscene.
Changes the actors walk style. Note: In GTA VC and GTA III, an integer is used as a anim group ID.
Loads a model.
Returns true if the specified model is available for creation.
Releases the specified model, freeing game memory.
Gets the phone at the specified X and Y coordinates.

Creates a corona at the specified coordinates. The RGB colour of the corona can be changed and a lensflare effect can be applied to the camera when near the corona. There are several types of coronas. Note that some of the coronas on that list do not work in San Andreas. See here for the ones that do. They may differ from the VC and III versions.
Saves the current time in game. Made for use with 0254.
Restores the game time to the time when it was saved with 0254.
Returns true if the player hasn't been wasted or busted (the player is still playing).
Tells the game to make the specified actor attack whoever attacks him.
Returns the controller mode. In SA this returns 0.
Enables or disables the ability to Pay'n'Spray the car.
Releases the special actor, freeing game memory.
Resets the count of how many times the player has destroyed a certain model.
Gets the amount of times the player has destroyed a specific model.
Enables widescreen.
Adds a contact sprite blip for the specified coordinates. This blip is visible on the radar at any distance.
Adds a sprite blip for the specified coordinates. This blip is visible on the radar at any distance.
Makes an actor invulnerable to everything except the player.
Makes a vehicle invulnerable to everything except the player.
Sets the characters immunities. BP = Bulletproof FP = Fireproof EP = Explosion-proof CP = Collision-proof MP = Melee-proof
sannyFormat: set_actor %1d% immunities BP %2d% FP %3d% EP %4d% CP %5d% MP %6d%

description: Gives vehicle the specified immunities. BP = Bulletproof FP = Fireproof EP = Explosion-proof CP = Collision-proof MP = Melee-proof

sannyFormat: player %1d% in_area_on_foot %2d% %3d% %4d% %5d% radius %6d% sphere %7h%  ;; never used anywhere
player %1d% in_area_in_car %2d% %3d% %4d% %5d% radius %6d% sphere %7h%  ;; never used anywhere
player %1d% stopped_in_area %2d% %3d% %4d% %5d% radius %6d% sphere %7h%  ;; never used anywhere
player %1d% stopped_in_area_on_foot %2d% %3d% %4d% %5d% radius %6d% sphere %7h%  ;; never used anywhere
player %1d% stopped_in_area_in_car %2d% %3d% %4d% %5d% radius %6d% sphere %7h%  ;; never used anywhere
player %1d% stopped_in_cube %2d% %3d% %4d% %5d% %6d% %7d% radius %8d% sphere %9h%  ;; never used anywhere
player %1d% stopped_in_cube_on_foot %2d% %3d% %4d% %5d% %6d% %7d% radius %8d% sphere %9h%  ;; never used anywhere
player %1d% stopped_in_cube_in_car %2d% %3d% %4d% %5d% %6d% %7d% radius %8d% sphere %9h%  ;; never used anywhere

description: Returns true if the vehicle is submerged in water.
Stores the nearest path from the specified coordinates that a pedestrian can walk on.
Stores the nearest path from the specified coordinates that a vehicle can drive on.
Makes the car drive to the specified X, Y and Z coordinates.
Returns true if the car is visible.
Returns true if the actor is visible.
Returns true if the object is visible.
Stores the ground position at the specified coordinates.
Creates a fire at the specified coordinates. The propagation parameter controls how much the fire can spread.
Returns true if the fire has been put out.
Removes the script created fire.
Makes the boat sail to the specified coordinates.
Turns of the cars engine.
Returns true if the actor is holding the weapon specified.
Sets the speed of the boat.
Gets a pedestrian in the specified town, if the pedtype matches the specified values.
Returns true if the character is firing a weapon.
Creates a money pickup with the specified cash value. Note: The parameter count for this opcode differs between games.
Affects how often the character will hit it's target when attacking with a weapon.
Gets the cars speed.
Loads the data for the specified cutscene.
Begins the loaded cutscene.
Returns true if the cutscene has finished.
Ends the current cutscene.
Restores the camera, putting it back behind the player.
Does nothing.
Specifies the total ammount of hidden packages to collect.
Returns true if the characters model ID is equivalent to the model ID passed.
Gets the X Coord of an angle.
Gets the Y Coord of an angle.
Gets the sine of the vehicles angle.
Gets the Y Angle of the vehicles angle.
Set the garage type for the specified garage.
Displays a GXT String with the 2 numbers specified.
Prints text from a GXT entry with 2 numbers.
Displays a GXT with 4 numbers.
Prints text with 6 numbers.
Increases the progress made stat by the specified amount.
Sets the maximum progress the player can reach.
Increases the mission attempts stat by 1.
Sets the GXT of the last mission passed. This same GXT is used for the save games. Affects the name used for the save game slot.
Puts out all fires.
Returns true if the specified actor has been hit by the specified weapon.
Returns true if the specified car is damaged by the specified weapon.
Dismembers the character.
Kills the player.
Makes the boat stay motionless in the water.
Creates a fire on the specified car.
Creates fire on the specified character.
Gets a random car with the specified model in the specified area.
Returns true if the players car has been resprayed by the garage.
Set how far behind the camera is from the player.
Creates a weapon pickup, giving the player the specified amount of ammo when he picks it up.
Sets the cars goal to ram another car.
Defines whether the player can run fast forever.
The player does not have to reload his gun. The ammo is immediately reloaded.
Makes an actor bleed.
Player can respray their car for free.
Sets whether the player is visible or not.
Sets the actors visibility.
Returns true if there is anything with the specified properties within the specified area.
sannyFormat: anything_in_cube_cornerA %1d% %2d% %3d% cornerB %4d% %5d% %6d% solid %7d% car %8d% actor %9d% object %10d% particle %11d%

description: Draws text at the specified on-screen position. Use in a loop to get text to stay on screen.
Sets the letter width and height to draw the text at.
Sets the RGBA to draw the text at.
Sets the text to be drawn justified, which means the text will wrap in order to fill an even rectangle of space.
Centers the text. This opcode does not set up a centre for texts.
Sets the line width of the text.
Gives the text a background.
Makes the text size proportionate.
Sets the text draw font.
Rotates the objects Z Angle from the first value to the second.

Returns true if the object has finished moving. If false, moves the object towards the specified X, Y and Z coordinates with the specified X, Y and Z speed. collision_check Changes whether the object should stop moving if there is a risk of collision.
Removes the character with a fade, freeing game memory.
sannyFormat: destroy_actor_with_fade %1d%  ;; The actor fades away like a ghost

description: Makes the actor maintain his position when attacked.
Places the object at an offset from the car.
Sets whether the object can be targetted or not. This mostly applies to the PS2/Xbox versions of the game.
Increases the actors armour by the specified value.
Opens the specified garage.
Closes the specified garage.
Removes the actor from his car and places him at the specified coordinates.
Sets the visibility of the object closest to the specified coordinates, matching the specified model.
Returns true if the object is damaged.
Puts the actor in the specified car.
Displays a styled GXT with 2 numbers.
Puts the camera behind the player.
Creates an actor with a randomized model and pedtype at the specified coordinates.
Returns true if a sniper bullet is in the specified area.
Throws the object towards the specified offset. To use this opcode, object movement must first be enabled using 0392.
Turns collision on or off for an object. When off, the object goes through walls, floors and other entities.
Returns true if the vehicles siren is on.
Shows 2 text strings, one replacing where ~a~ occurs in the other.
Returns true if there is a vehicle in the specified area.
Loads any requested models.
Draws a texture at the specified on-screen X and Y coordinates, with the specified size and RGBA colour.
sannyFormat: draw_texture %1h% position %2d% %3d% size %4d% %5d% RGBA %6d% %7d% %8d% %9d%  ;; never used in VC or GTA 3

description: Draws a box at the specified on screen X and Y position, with the specified size and RGBA colours. Box will remain visible until text draw is turned off.
sannyFormat: draw_box_position %1d% %2d% size %3d% %4d% RGBA %5h% %6h% %7h% %8d%  ;; never used in VC or GTA 3

description: Loads a texture from the most recently loaded .txd dictionary for drawing.
sannyFormat: load_texture %2h% as %1d%  ; Load dictionary with 0390 first

description: Changes the .txd file that the game will read from when loading a texture.
sannyFormat: load_txd_dictionary %1h%  ;; never used in VC or GTA 3

description: Unloads all currently loaded textures, as well as texture dictionaries, freeing game memory.
Makes an object movable with certain opcodes.
Plays various music/soundtracks with the specified ID, such as the San Andreas main theme.

Clears an area at the specified coordinates, removing all vehicles and pedestrians. If the first boolean parameter is set to 1, all projectiles and particles are cleared - even if they are not in the specified area.
Makes the on-screen timer stop incrementing.
Enables or disables a cars siren.
sannyFormat: car %1d% siren = %2b:on/off%  ;; never used in VC

description: Makes the vehicle watertight, meaning characters inside will not be harmed if the vehicle is submerged in water. Has no affect if the player is driving the vehicle.
Locks an actor while in a car.
Sets the cars heading so that it is facing the 2D coordinate.
Displays a red sphere similar to those displayed by [opcat]Locate[/opcat] opcodes.
Sets the cars status. 0 - Unlocks the vehicle from the AI and allows the player to drive again.
Returns true if the char is male.
Names the current thread. There is a 7 character limit. Any extra characters will be cut-off. Must be short string and use only letters and numbers. Example: 'MY_SCR1'
This command was used by Rockstar North for debugging to save an integer to a debug file.
This command was used by Rockstar North for debugging to save a float to the debug file.
This command was used by Rockstar North for debugging to write a newline to a debug file.
Plays police radio message audio reporting the suspect has last been seen in the area specified by the coordinates.
Makes the car stronger.
Toggles garbage.
Sets whether the map should be streamed.
Returns true if the garage door is open.
Returns true if the garage door is closed.
Changes an IPL-placed object model.
Sets whether to load world collision.
Clears all cars from a specified area.

Creates a static sphere at the specified coordinates, with the specified radius. Note: This is not the command used for most markers in the games. Instead, specific "locate" commands are used which also return whether the entering sphere conditions are met, e.g. 00FE.
Destroys a static sphere.
Makes pedestrians pay no attention to the player.
Gets the characters vehicle handle without marking it as used by the script, therefore allowing it to be deleted by the game at any time. Returns 0 if no vehicle is found.
Starts spawning random cars at the specified location.
Sets sensitivity to crime, changing how many crimes a player can commit before police begin to persue. 1.0 = default 2.0 = wanted level will increase twice as fast
Puts the camera in front of the player, pointing towards the player.
Returns true if the object exists.
Starts loading a specific location, just like if the player was there, removing LOD textures. Makes the location load quickly and stops loading other locations.
Returns true if the car is stuck.
Loads a specified sound from the audio files. An integer is often used to refer to the loaded audio. A string is used to identify the audio in GTA 3 and Vice City.
Returns true if the audio has loaded.
Plays an audio.
Returns true if the audio is no longer playing.
Returns the position and heading of the closest vehicle path node to the specified position.
Returns true if the import slot has been filled.
Clears the print from the screen.
Clears the styled GXT from the screen.
Sets an audio's location.
Displays a screen prompting the player to save.
Returns true if the player has saved their game.
Creates a marker above a pickup.
Sets the amount of pedestrians to spawn in the game. For example: 0.0 = no peds 1.0 = default 2.0 = twice the amount of peds
Forces a model on all randomly spawning peds.
Gets the number of collectable1s collected.

Causes the next texture to be drawn before the fade is drawn. Setting to TRUE this will enable textures to fade out, FALSE enables textures to draw while the screen is faded out. This is TRUE by default. Anything drawn with the flag set will draw behind anything without the flag set (03E0 for text).
Sets the text draw to be aligned to the right.
Displays a black text box for a few seconds.
Removes the text box from the screen.
Makes a specific part of the HUD disappear and reappear several times. San Andreas 3 = Armour Meter 4 = Energy Meter 8 = Radar 10 = Oxygen Meter (No missing values).
Clears small messages from the screen.
Disables a car from exploding when it is upside down, as long as the player is not in the vehicle. Works with actors, though.
Returns true if the player can move.
Makes the player safe, putting the character in a safe location.
Enables text and texture drawing. 0 == Enable once 1 == Enable forever* * or until any other script changes this setting.
Gets the cars primary and secondary colours.
Sets whether all cars receive damage.
Sets whether the car receives damage.
Sets the actors cash sum, setting how much cash they will drop when dead. Does not apply to player.
Gets the coordinates of an object with an offset.
Stores the coordinates of an offset of the vehicles position.
Sets the total number of rampage side-missions.
Kaboom!
Returns true if the game is in French.
Returns true if the players game language is set to German.
Unloads the audio, freeing game memory.
Makes the player receive free medical treatment once, meaning the player does not loose cash when he dies.
Loads a mission from the main.scm and launches it. Crashes the game if used while another mission is in progress.
Sets the specified object to always draw on top of other objects.

Sets the current radio station that is playing, if the player is in a vehicle. San Andreas The radio station ID passed is incremented by 1. However, 11 is replaced with 12 before the increment. It is possible that 12 is replaced with 13 after the increment, in certain cases.
Returns true if the players computer has it's settings to use metric measurements (metres instead of inches).
Converts the given number of metres to feet and returns the result.
Causes the vehicle to prefer paths which travel along the same altitude. This is used to make it easier for the player to seek out target vehicles.
Clears all pedestrians from the given area.
Sets the total number of missions that can be completed.
Converts the given number of metres to an imperial value and stores the result in a variable. Integer version of 0425.
If the value is lower than the current set stat value, the stat will be set to the new value.
Returns true if the specified passenger seat is empty.
Sets whether the actor is a psychotic killer or not. If so, he will usually go around attacking people.
Makes the credits scroll up the screen. These use GXT entries whose entry name begins with "CRED" or "CRD". The credit scenes themselves are hard-coded.
Stops the credits text from showing. See Also 0434
Returns true if the credits have finished. See Also 0434, 0435
Sets whether sounds should fade along with the screen.
Plays the theme tune.
Stops the theme tune.
Returns the cars model ID.
Returns true if the player is in the specific vehicle.
Returns true if the player is in any vehicle.
Returns true if the player has used any of the following cheats: Insane Handling Cars Drive on Water Boats Fly
Sets whether the specified character is immune to headshots. GTA III Sets whether the limbs of the char can be shot off.
Returns true if the character is in the specified car.
Returns true if the character is occupying any vehicle.
Returns true if the player is not occupying a vehicle.
Returns true if the character is on foot, and not occupying a vehicle.
Loads the specified splash screen.
A really specific opcode.
Loads the end of game music.
Sets an objects X, Y and Z rotation.
Returns the debug camera position.
Returns true if the player is aiming at the specified character.
Remotely ends the thread with the specified name, freeing game memory.
Draws text with 1 number.
Draws text with 2 numbers.
Aborts the mission.
Sets how long the transition will last when using 0160 and other opcodes with the transition parameter.
Stores the X, Y and Z coordinates the debug camera is pointing to.
Puts actor into a turret on a car, allowing them to shoot.
sannyFormat: put_actor %1d% into_turret_on_car %2d% at_car_offset %3d% %4d% %5d% position %6h% angle %7d% with_weapon %8h%

description: Removes the character from turret mode.
Clears the characters last weapon damage.
Clears a vehicles last weapon damage.
Gets a random law enforcement ped of any of the specified types in the 2D area.
The character will leave his car and run away from it.
Returns the cars driver.
Returns the number of members which are in a group of the actor.
Puts the player in control of a radio controlled vehicle.
Stores the weapon that the player is currently holding.
Returns the ID of the characters current weapon.
Returns true if the character is near the object.
Returns true if character is near the object on foot.

Makes the vehicle perform an action. Action documentation was originally posted by fastman92 in this post. Actions 0 - Brake without lights 1 - Brake with lights 2 - Brake without lights 3 - Reverse 4 - Turn left wide 5 - Turn right wide 7 - Drive forward and turn left 8 - Drive forward and turn right 9 - Drive forward 10 - Turn left slightly 11 - Turn right slightly 13 - Reverse and turn left 14 - Reverse and turn right 19 - Turn left slightly, flash the rear lights 20 - Turn left slightly, switch rear lights on for 4 seconds 21 - Turn right slightly, switch rear lights for 4 seconds 22 - Drive back 23 - Drive forward very fast 24 - Switch lights on at animation time
Returns true if the actor is driving a bike.
Returns true if the player is driving a motorbike.
Does nothing.
Returns the players radio-controlled vehicle.
Returns true on PC versions of the game.
Returns true if the specified model exists in the loaded .img file.
Shuts a character up.
Enables RC vehicle detonation. Related Opcodes 04D6
Sets the car on a specific route.
Returns true if the pickup at the specified coordinates is available to be picked up.
Removes the characters weapons.
Returns true if the player has the specified weapon.

Returns the offset of the specified Left/Right, Up/Down, Look Left/Look Right and Look Up/Look Down keys. Joystick ID is eqivalent to the player id, which can be 0 for player 1 and 1 for player 2 (as well as the relevant global varible). Returned Values 1. Movement. Left: 128 - Right: -128 2. Movement. Up: 128 - Down: -128 3. Special Ctrl. Left: -128 - Right: 128 4. Special Ctrl. Up: -128 - Down: 128
Returns true if the car is burning.
Returns true if the specified car tire is deflated.
Does nothing.
Does nothing.
Makes the helicopter fly to the specified location, keeping a specific Z height/altitude.
In Rockstar Norths GTA3script compiler, this opcode is used when testing the value of a variable against that of a constant.

Returns true if the first Local Variable is equivalent to the second. Is used with both floats and integers. In Rockstar Norths GTA3script compiler, this opcode is used when testing the value of a variable against that of a constant.
Returns appropriate coordinates for creating a pickup by a dead character.
Returns true if the character is in water.

Stores the value of the second variable into the first variable. Is used with both floats and integers. In Rockstars Norths GTA3script compiler, this opcode is used when assigning a variable to the value of a constant.
Stores the specified value into a variable. Is used with both floats and integers. In Rockstar Norths GTA3script compiler, this opcode is used when assigning a variable to the value of a constant.

Returns true if the value of the variable is higher than specified value. Is used with both floats and integers. In Rockstar Norths GTA3script compiler, this opcode is used where the value of a variables is compared with the value of a constant.

Returns true if the value of the variable is higher than specified value. Is used with both floats and integers. In Rockstars native compiler, this opcode is used where the value of a variables is compared with the value of a constant.

Returns true if the value of the variable is lower than specified value. Is used with both floats and integers. In Rockstars native compiler, this opcode is used where the value of a variable is compared with the value of a constant.

Returns true if the value of the variable is lower than specified value. Is used with both floats and integers. In Rockstars native compiler, this opcode is used where the value of a variable is compared with the value of a constant.

Returns true if the variable is equivalent to or higher than the specified value. Is used with both floats and integers. In Rockstars native compiler, this opcode is used where the value of a variables is compared with the value of a constant.

Returns true if the variable is equivalent to or higher than the specified value. Is used with both floats and integers. In Rockstars native compiler, this opcode is used where the value of a variable is compared with the value of a constant.

Returns true if the variable is equivalent to or lower than the specified value. Is used with both floats and integers. In Rockstars native compiler, this opcode is used where the value of a variable is compared with the value of a constant.

Returns true if the variable is equivalent to or lower than the specified value. Is used with both floats and integers. In Rockstars native compiler, this opcode is used where the value of a variable is compared with the value of a constant.
Returns the weapon id, ammo and model from the specified slot.
Gets the closest straight section of road.
Sets the speed of the car.
Sets the current interiors ID that the game loads.
Does nothing.
Marks the car as being part of a convoy, which seems to follow a path set by 0994.
Does nothing.
Creates a roadblock in the specified area with the specified type.
Removes references to all created roadblocks, freeing game memory.
